intro: Antirrhinum barrelieri var. ruscinonense, commonly known as the Ruscinonese toadflax, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in some areas.
